name: RegWatchEurope
goal:
As a Network, we collaborate to achieve the following:

1. To strengthen our own expertise by exchanging knowledge and sharing best practice;
2. To strengthen the EU approach on better regulation;
3. To inform other countries, particularly Member States/ EFTA States on the added value of external and independent IA scrutiny on national platforms, or through international organisations;
4. To advise our governments on the quality of EU impact assessments;
5. To advise our governments on possible reductions within the stock of EU legislation.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: Currently, RegWatchEurope is particularly interested in the Better Regulation agenda of the Juncker Commission and the European Parliament.
